overview:
## Overview

In iOS and macOS, the default algorithm for playback for apps linked on or after iOS 15 or macOS 12 is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/timeDomain].

For iOS versions prior to iOS 15, the default value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/lowQualityZeroLatency], and for macOS versions prior to macOS 12, the default value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral].

The default value for export and other offline processing is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral].

For scaled audio edits, such as when the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetTrackSegment/timeMapping] of an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetTrackSegment] is between `timeRanges` of unequal duration, it’s important to choose an algorithm that supports the full range of edit rates present in the source media. The pitch algorithm [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral] is often the best choice due to the highly inclusive range of rates it supports, assuming that it’s desirable to maintain a constant pitch regardless of the edit rate. If it’s desirable to allow the pitch to vary with the edit rate, [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/varispeed] is the best choice.

# Time pitch algorithm settings

**API Collection**

The constants that define the values for the time pitch algorithms.

## Overview

In iOS and macOS, the default algorithm for playback for apps linked on or after iOS 15 or macOS 12 is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/timeDomain].

For iOS versions prior to iOS 15, the default value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/lowQualityZeroLatency], and for macOS versions prior to macOS 12, the default value is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral].

The default value for export and other offline processing is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral].

For scaled audio edits, such as when the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetTrackSegment/timeMapping] of an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetTrackSegment] is between `timeRanges` of unequal duration, it’s important to choose an algorithm that supports the full range of edit rates present in the source media. The pitch algorithm [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/spectral] is often the best choice due to the highly inclusive range of rates it supports, assuming that it’s desirable to maintain a constant pitch regardless of the edit rate. If it’s desirable to allow the pitch to vary with the edit rate, [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAudioTimePitchAlgorithm/varispeed] is the best choice.

## Constants

- **timeDomain**: A modest quality time pitch algorithm that’s suitable for voice.
- **varispeed**: A high-quality time pitch algorithm that doesn’t perform pitch correction.
- **spectral**: A highest-quality time pitch algorithm that’s suitable for music.
- **lowQualityZeroLatency**: A low-quality and very low computationally intensive pitch algorithm.

## Settings

- **Sample rate conversion settings**: The constants that define sample rate converter audio quality settings.
- **AVAudioQuality**: The values that specify the sample rate audio quality for encoding and conversion.
- **Encoder settings**: The constants that define the audio encoder settings for the audio recorder class.
